label: A_oC4_63_c-001
title: $\alpha$-U ($A20$) Structure
comments:
Uranium has two structural phase transitions with temperature (Donohue, 1974): \begin{itemize} \item Below 662$^\circ$C it is in the ground state \href{current_web_home_dir/A_oC4_63_c-001}{$\alpha$-U structure ($A20$)}. (this structure) \item In the range 662-772$^\circ$C it is in the \href{current_web_home_dir/A_tP30_136_af2ij-001}{$\beta$-U structure ($A_{b}$)}. \item Above 772$^\circ$C to the melting point at 1135$^\circ$C it is in the \href{current_web_home_dir/A_cI2_229_a-001}{body-centered cubic structure ($A2$)}. \end{itemize} ~ \vspace{-.25in} 
 We show the $\alpha$-U structure at 4.2K. 
 (Vohra, 2001) showed that at pressures above 116 GPa titanium transforms from the hexagonal omega ($C32$) phase to this phase. 
 This structure was studied by (Wentzcovitch, 1987) as a possible pathway for the pressure-induced transformation of magnesium from the hcp ($A3$) to the bcc ($A2$) phase. 
 Much like the trigonal omega phase (\href{current_web_home_dir/AB2_hP3_164_a_d-001}{$C6$}), we can generate several high-symmetry structures from this phase with the appropriate choice of parameters: ~ \vspace{-.25in} \begin{center} \begin{tabular}{ccccc} \\  \textbf{Lattice} \textbf{Parameter} & \textbf{hcp} & \textbf{bcc} & \textbf{fcc} & \textbf{Simple} \textbf{Cubic} \\ \hline  $a$ & $a_{hcp}$ & $a_{bcc}$ & $a_{fcc}$ & $\sqrt{2}a_{sc}$ \\  $b$ & $\sqrt{3}a_{hcp}$ & $\sqrt{2}a_{bcc}$ & $a_{fcc}$ & $\sqrt{2}a_{sc}$ \\  $c$ & $c_{hcp}$ & $\sqrt{2}a_{bcc}$ & $a$ & $2 a_{sc}$ \\  $y$ & $\frac16$ & $\frac14$ & $\frac14$ & 0 \\ {\em Strukturbericht} & \href{current_web_home_dir/A_hP2_194_c-001}{$A3$} & \href{current_web_home_dir/A_cI2_229_a-001}{$A2$} & \href{current_web_home_dir/A_cF4_225_a-001}{$A1$} & \href{current_web_home_dir/A_cP1_221_a-001}{$A_{h}$} \\ Pearson Symbol & hP2 & cI2 & cF4 & cP1 \\ Space group & $P6_{3}/mmc$ & $Im\overline{3}m$ & $Fm\overline{3}m$ & $Pm\overline{3}m$ \\ Number & 194 & 229 & 225 & 221 \end{tabular} \end{center} ~ \vspace{-.25in} (This corrects the values of $a$ and $b$ for the simple cubic structure published in (Mehl, 2017).)
